p: The EOs of C. nubigenum and L. angustifolia managed to deter oviposition by L. sericata. After 3 h, both EOs completely inhibited oviposition (OD% = 100), starting from a dose of 0.4 and 0.8 μL cm -2 for L. angustifolia and C. nubigenum, respectively, with no differences between the two EOs ( F 1,16 = 0.106; P = 0.749). After 24 h the most effective EO ( F 1,16 = 5.522; P = 0.032) was the C. nubigenum one with an OD% ranging from 72.6 to 89.5, while the OD% of the L. angustifolia ranged from 7.2 to 82.7, at 0.2 and 0.8 μL cm -2, respectively ( Table 2).
